unnormalised: So, I was wondering about something the other day, and thought I'd ask here. What exactly do all the titles in the medical field *really* mean? I mean, you've got everything from "Dr." to "Prof." to "MD" to "BDS," and honestly, it's a bit confusing. I'm sure there's a logical explanation, but it's not always clear from just looking at a doctor's nameplate! Especially here in India, where we have ayurvedic doctors (like "Vaidya" or "Dr. (Ayurveda)") along with allopathic ones.
normalised: So, I was wondering about something the other day, and thought I would ask here. What exactly do all the titles in the medical field really mean? I mean, you have got everything from "doctor" to "professor" to "M-D" to "B-D-S," and honestly, it is a bit confusing. I am sure there is a logical explanation, but it is not always clear from just looking at a doctor's nameplate! Especially here in India, where we have ayurvedic doctors (like "Vaidya" or "doctor (Ayurveda)") along with allopathic ones.

unnormalised: For example, what's the difference between a "Dr." and a "Prof."? Is a "Prof." always a more experienced "Dr."? And what about degrees like "MBBS" or "MS"? Are they just basic qualifications, or do they signify something more specialized? Then you have these honorifics like "Padma Shri Dr." before a name - what does that even mean in the context of their medical practice? A little clarity would be super helpful. I saw Dr. Sharma had MD, DM after his name. What are those?!
normalised: For example, what is the difference between a "doctor" and a "professor"? Is a "professor" always a more experienced "doctor"? And what about degrees like "M-B-B-S" or "M-S"? Are they just basic qualifications, or do they signify something more specialized? Then you have these honorifics like "Padma Shri doctor" before a name - what does that even mean in the context of their medical practice? A little clarity would be super helpful. I saw Doctor Sharma had M-D, D-M after his name. What are those?!

unnormalised: I'm mostly curious because my grandpa's been seeing "Dr. R. Kumar, MBBS, DNB" for his heart issues, and I want to make sure he's getting the best possible care. Also, I'm hoping to prepone my own medical check-up, and the online booking only shows titles like "Dr." and "Asst. Prof". It would be great to know who I should select! I remember seeing a dentist with "BDS" last year. Now I'm questioning if they have the same level of qualification as others.
normalised: I am mostly curious because my grandpa has been seeing "Doctor R. Kumar, M-B-B-S, D-N-B" for his heart issues, and I want to make sure he is getting the best possible care. Also, I am hoping to prepone my own medical check-up, and the online booking only shows titles like "doctor" and "assistant professor". It would be great to know who I should select! I remember seeing a dentist with "B-D-S" last year. Now I am questioning if they have the same level of qualification as others.

unnormalised: Thanks in advance for any insights you can share. Hopefully, this will help others navigate the maze of medical titles a little easier too! Any experiences with different types of medical professionals ("Dr.", "Vaidya", "Hakim") would be much appreciated!
normalised: Thanks in advance for any insights you can share. Hopefully, this will help others navigate the maze of medical titles a little easier too! Any experiences with different types of medical professionals ("doctor", "Vaidya", "Hakim") would be much appreciated!
